trans-unit.source: Serves as the root class of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart"></xref> control.
This class exposes all of the properties, methods and events of the Chart Windows control.

Two important properties of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart> class are the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.Series%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.ChartAreas%2A> properties, both of which are collection properties.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.Series%2A> collection property stores <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Series> objects, which are used to store data that is to be displayed, along with attributes of that data.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.ChartAreas%2A> collection property stores <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartArea> objects, which are primarily used to draw one or more charts using one set of axes.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart"></xref> class.
You can use this constructor to create a new instance of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart> class at run time.
However, for simplicity, it is recommended that you create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart> instance at design time.
This is the root object of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart> control.
Aligns data points along the X axis using their axis labels.
Applicable when multiple series are indexed and their X-values are strings.
Aligns data points from different series along the X axis using their axis labels.
The specified series in the chart are aligned using an ascending sort order.
This method is used to align data points from different series along the X axis using their axis labels, and is applicable when:

Multiple series are displayed and are indexed; that is, all data points have an <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPoint.XValue%2A> of 0, or the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Series.IsXValueIndexed%2A> property is `true`.
All data points have non-empty axis labels, which are unique to their <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Series>.
If they are not unique, an exception will be thrown.
This situation is very common when data-binding results in the creation of multiple series, and `string` values are used for X-axis values.
Two issues arise when multiple, indexed series are plotted, and the X-values are set using `string` values:
It cannot be guaranteed that data points from different series with the same string X-values will be plotted at the same index along the X axis.
Only the axis label for the data points in the first series will be displayed, even though data points from other series with the same index have axis labels too.
By default, points are plotted in the order in which they are stored in their series.
To specify a sort order, use an `AlignDataPointsByAxisLabel` method overload that has a `sortingOrder` parameter.
A comma-separated list of series that will have their data points aligned to the X axis using the data point axis labels.
Aligns data points using their axis labels.
All series in the chart are aligned, using the specified sort order.

A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.PointSortOrder"></xref> object that indicates if ascending or descending sort order is used on axis labels, which in turn determines the order by which points that previously occupied the same axis space are displayed.
Aligns data points using their axis labels.
This method is used to align data points from different series along the X axis using their axis labels, and is applicable when:

Multiple series are displayed and are indexed; that is, all data points have an <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPoint.XValue%2A> of 0, or the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Series.IsXValueIndexed%2A> property is `true`.
All data points have non-empty axis labels, which are unique to their <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Series>.
If they are not unique, an exception will be thrown.
This situation is very common when data-binding results in the creation of multiple series, and `string` values are used for X-axis values.
Two issues arise when multiple, indexed series are plotted, and the X-values are set using `string` values:
It cannot be guaranteed that data points from different series with the same string X-values will be plotted at the same index along the X axis.
Only the axis label for the data points in the first series will be displayed, even though data points from other series with the same index have axis labels too.
By default, points are plotted in the order in which they are stored in their series.
To specify a sort order, use an `AlignDataPointsByAxisLabel` method overload that has a `sortingOrder` parameter.
A comma-separated list of series that should be aligned by axis label.

A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.PointSortOrder"></xref> enumeration value that determines if ascending or descending sort order is used on axis labels, which in turn determines the order by which points that previously occupied the same axis space are displayed.
Occurs when the end-user places an annotation on the chart.
Occurs when the annotation position is changed.
Occurs when the annotation position is about to change.
Gets or sets a collection that stores the chart annotations.
All of the chart annotations are stored in this collection property.
An <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.AnnotationCollection"></xref> object that is used to store chart annotations.
Occurs when a selection of the annotation is changed.
Occurs when the annotation text is changed.
Gets or sets a value that determines whether anti-aliasing is used when text and graphics are drawn.
Anti-aliasing smoothens out "jagged edges" by padding pixels with intermediate colors, and is especially effective for smoothing out edges for charts that are not drawn as rectangles.
For example, anti-aliasing is very effective for line charts and pie charts, but is not as effective for bar and column charts.
Anti-aliasing can be applied to text and/or graphics primitives such as rectangles, circles, and so forth.
Note that anti-aliasing will affect performance.
An <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.AntiAliasingStyles"></xref> enumeration value that determines whether anti-aliasing is used when text and graphics are drawn.
Sets the automatically assigned series and data point colors, to allow programmatic access at run time.

When the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart> colors are automatically assigned at run time, there is no way to know what the colors will be prior to the time when the chart rendered; the `Color` property of an automatically assigned value will return <xref:System.Drawing.Color.Empty> at this time.

If you call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.ApplyPaletteColors%2A> method, the colors for the series and the data points will be set, which allows for programmatic access.
Occurs when the axis scroll bar is clicked by the end-user.
Occurs when the axis scale view position or size is changed.
Occurs when the axis scale view position or size is about to change.
Gets or sets the background color of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart"></xref> object.
You can set this property to any valid ARGB (alpha, red, green, blue) value.
Note that for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart> object, the alpha component cannot be set to a value other than 255.
This also means that, for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart> object only, a <xref:System.Drawing.Color.Transparent%2A> value cannot be used.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.BackColor%2A> value will be the first color used if you are using gradient colors for the background.
The alpha value controls the opacity of a color.
If you set this color to "transparent"—that is, if you use an alpha value of 0—no color will be assigned to the background of the title.
As a result, the background will be transparent.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> value used to draw the background color of the chart.
The default color is <xref href="System.Drawing.Color.White"></xref>.
Gets or sets the orientation for the background gradient of a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart"></xref> control.
Also determines whether a gradient is used.

Use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.BackGradientStyle%2A> property to determine whether a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart> control will display a gradient, and to determine the orientation of the gradient if one is used.
For a listing of available patterns, refer to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.GradientStyle> enumeration.
To use gradient colors:
Set the primary color of the chart background with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.BackColor%2A> property.
Set the secondary color of the chart background with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.BackSecondaryColor%2A> property.
Set this <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.BackGradientStyle%2A> property to the desired gradient style.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.GradientStyle"></xref> enumeration that specifies the orientation for the background gradient of a chart and whether a gradient is used.
The default value is <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.GradientStyle.None"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.BackgroundImage"></xref> property is not used.
Use the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.BackImage"></xref> property instead.
An <xref href="System.Drawing.Image"></xref> object.
Gets or sets the hatching style of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart"></xref> control.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartHatchStyle> enumeration specifies the hatch pattern used by a brush of type <xref:System.Drawing.Drawing2D.HatchBrush>.
The hatch pattern consists of a solid background color and lines drawn over the background.
For a listing of available hatching styles, refer to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartHatchStyle> enumeration.
**Note** The color of hatching lines is determined by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.BackSecondaryColor%2A> property.

A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartHatchStyle"></xref> enumeration that specifies the hatching style of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart"></xref> control.
The default value is <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartHatchStyle.None"></xref>.
Gets or sets the background image of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart"></xref> control.
This property defines a path to a background image for a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart> legend, and can be an absolute or relative URL.

To position the image, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.BackImageAlignment%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.BackImageWrapMode%2A> properties.
You can also specify one of the colors displayed by the image as "transparent", by setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.BackImageTransparentColor%2A> property.
An image can originate from any valid graphics file supported by .NET Framework, including icons.
Background images take precedence over other background properties such as gradient color.
A `string` value that represents the URL of an image file.
The default value is an empty string.
Gets or sets the background image alignment used for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartImageWrapMode.Unscaled"></xref> drawing mode.

This property determines the alignment of the background image for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart> control; it is only applied when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.BackImageWrapMode%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartImageWrapMode>.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartImageAlignmentStyle"></xref> enumeration value that specifies the background image alignment of the chart.
The default value is <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartImageAlignmentStyle.TopLeft"></xref>.
Gets or sets the color of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart"></xref> control that will be displayed as transparent.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> value that will be displayed as transparent when the chart image is drawn.
The default value is <xref href="System.Drawing.Color.Empty"></xref>.
Gets or sets the drawing mode for the background image of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart"></xref> control.
This property determines how the image is displayed, for example, tiled, scaled, and so forth.
If an image is scaled, it will be stretched to fit within the bounds of the chart.
If the image is tiled, it is repeatedly drawn, starting from the top-left corner of the chart.
For more information about the available wrapping modes, see the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartImageWrapMode> enumeration topic.

If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.BackImageWrapMode%2A> property is set to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartImageWrapMode>, the location where the image is drawn is determined by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.BackImageAlignment%2A> property setting.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartImageWrapMode"></xref> enumeration value that specifies the drawing mode for the background image of the chart.
The default value is <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartImageWrapMode.Tile"></xref>.
Gets or sets the secondary color of the chart background.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.BackSecondaryColor%2A> property determines the secondary background color of many <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart> objects, and is used when gradient colors are being applied.
You can set <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.BackSecondaryColor%2A> to any valid ARGB (alpha, red, green, blue) value.
If hatching is used, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.BackSecondaryColor%2A> property determines the color of the hatching lines for the chart.
To use gradient colors for the background of a chart:
Set the primary color with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.BackColor%2A> property.
Set the secondary color with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.BackSecondaryColor%2A> property.
Set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.BackGradientStyle%2A> property to the desired gradient style.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> value that represents the secondary color of the chart background.
The default value is <xref href="System.Drawing.Color.Empty"></xref>.
Signals to the object that initialization is starting.
Gets or sets the color of the chart border.
To get or set the border color, use <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.BorderlineColor%2A> instead.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> value used to draw the chart border.
Gets or sets the style of the border.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartDashStyle"></xref> enumeration value that specifies the style of the border.
Gets or sets the color of the border line.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> value used to draw the border line.
Gets or sets the style of the border line.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartDashStyle"></xref> enumeration value that specifies the style of the border line.
Gets or sets the width of the border line.
An `integer` value that specifies the width of the border line.

Gets or sets a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.BorderSkin"></xref> object, which provides border skin functionality for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart"></xref> control.
Use this property to specify a border skin for the chart.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.BorderSkin"></xref> object which provides border skin functionality for the chart.
Gets or set s the width of the chart border.
To get or set of the border width, use <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.BorderlineWidth%2A> instead.
An `integer` value that determines the border width, in pixels, of the chart.
Gets the build number of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart"></xref> control.
A `string` that represents the build number of the chart control.

Gets a read-only <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartAreaCollection"></xref> object that is used to store <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartArea"></xref> objects.

This collection property lets you access the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartAreaCollection> object, which stores <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartArea> objects and also provides methods and properties used to manipulate the collection.
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartArea> objects are used to plot one or more charts.

A read-only <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartAreaCollection"></xref> object that contains collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartArea"></xref> objects.
When overridden in a derived class, returns the custom <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject"></xref> for the entire chart.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.AccessibleObject"></xref> for the chart.
Occurs when the cursor position is changed.
Occurs when the cursor position is about to change.
Occurs just before the chart image is drawn.
Use this event to customize the chart picture.
Occurs when the chart legend must be customized.
Data binds the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart"></xref> control to a data source.
This method will bind the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart> control to the specified data source.

In cases where a data source is set to a chart and no other data operations are required, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.DataBind%2A> method does not have to be explicitly called.
In these cases, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart> itself will data bind to the data source prior to being rendered.
Data binds a chart to the table, with one series created per unique value in a given column.

Series will be automatically added to the chart, depending on the number of unique values in the given `seriesGroupByField` column of the data source; in other words, the creation of series depends upon grouping of a column.
The data source can be a <xref:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbDataReader>, <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlDataReader> or a <xref:System.Data.DataView> object.
Note that all collections that implement the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable> interface can be used.
Other data point properties besides X and Y-values can be bound.
The format is: PointProperty=Field[{Format}] [,PointProperty= Field[{Format}]].
For example:"Tooltip=Price{C1},Href=WebSiteName".
These data point properties are:
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPointCustomProperties.CustomProperties%2A?displayProperty=fullName>, which are the names of the custom properties.
The data source that is data bound by a chart.
The name of the field used to group data into the series.
The name of the field for X values.
A comma-separated list of name(s) of the field(s) for Y value(s).
The other data point properties that can be bound.
Data binds a chart to the table, with one series created per unique value in a given column.

Series will be automatically added to the chart, depending on the number of unique values in the given `seriesGroupByField` column of the data source; in other words, the creation of series depends upon grouping of a column.
The data source can be a <xref:System.Data.OleDb.OleDbDataReader>, <xref:System.Data.SqlClient.SqlDataReader> or a <xref:System.Data.DataView> object.
Note that all collections that implement the <xref:System.Collections.IEnumerable> interface can be used.
Other data point properties besides X and Y-values can be bound.
The format is: PointProperty=Field[{Format}] [,PointProperty= Field[{Format}]].
For example:"Tooltip=Price{C1},Href=WebSiteName".
These data point properties are:
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPointCustomProperties.CustomProperties%2A>, which are the names of the custom properties
The data source that is data bound by a chart.
The name of the field used to group data into the series.
The name of the field for X values.
A comma-separated list of name(s) of the field(s) for Y value(s).
The other data point properties that can be bound.
The order in which the series will be sorted by group field values.
Automatically creates and binds series data to the specified data table.
Each column of the table becomes a Y-value for a series, with one series per column.
The data source that is data bound by a chart, which can be any <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerable"></xref> object.
Automatically creates and binds series data to the specified data table, and optionally populates X-values.
Each column of the table becomes a Y-value for a series, with one series per column.
The series' X-value field can also be provided.
The data source that is data bound by a chart, which can be any <xref href="System.Collections.IEnumerable"></xref> object.
The name of the field used for the series X-values.
Gets a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.DataManipulator"></xref> object that provides methods and properties that handle data.
Use this property at run-time to:
Copy Y-values.
Filter data.
Group data.
Replace missing data with empty points.
Export data to a <xref:System.Data.DataSet> object.
Sort data.
Apply a financial formula to data.
Refer to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.DataManipulator> class overview for further details.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.DataManipulator"></xref> object that provides methods and properties that handle data.
Gets or sets the data source for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart"></xref> object.
The data points in a series can be bound to a data source at any time using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.DataSource%2A> property.
To force the chart to bind to the data source, call the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.DataBind%2A> method.
The following is a list of objects that you can use as the data source:
DataView
Data readers (SQL, OleDB)
DataSet
DataTable
Binding Source
IDataSource
Arrays
Lists
All Enumerable objects
SqlCommand / OleDbCommand (DataSource data-binding only)
SqlDataAdapter / OleDbDataAdapter (DataSource data-binding only)
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that represents the data source for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart"></xref> object.
Gets the default control size.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Size"></xref> object that represents the default size of the control.
Releases unmanaged and, optionally, managed resources.
`true` to release both unmanaged and managed resources; `false` to release only unmanaged resources.
Signals to the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart"></xref> object that initialization is complete.
Gets the font properties of the control.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> object that represents the text font of the control.
Gets or sets the text color of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart"></xref> control.
This property is not applicable to this class.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> value that specifies the text color of the chart.
Occurs when a numeric value has to be converted to a string.
Returns the chart element outline.
If the `chartElement` is not part of the chart, or the `elementType` cannot be combined with `chartElement`, the result will contain an empty array of marker points.
The marker points are sorted clockwise.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart"></xref> object.
The type of the element.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartElementOutline"></xref> object that contains:
An array of points in absolute coordinates that can be used as outline markers around this chart element.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Drawing2D.GraphicsPath"></xref> object for drawing an outline around this chart element.
Returns the requested chart service.
The type of requested chart service.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that represents the service type, or `null` if the service cannot be found.
Occurs before showing the tooltip to get the tooltip text.
Determines the chart element, if any, that is located at a point defined by the given X and Y coordinates.
Call this method to determine the chart element, if any, which is located at a specified point.

The properties of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.HitTestResult> object that is returned can then be used to determine which chart element was clicked; the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.HitTestResult> object also provides an instance of the actual object selected, if any.
The X-coordinate value of the point the user clicked.
The Y-coordinate value of the point the user clicked.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.HitTestResult"></xref> object, which provides information concerning the chart element, if any, that is at the specified location.
Determines the chart element, if any, that is located at a point defined by given X and Y coordinates.
Transparent elements can optionally be ignored.
Call this method to determine the chart element, if any, which is located at a specified point.
To ignore transparent elements, set the `ignoreTransparent` parameter to `true`.

The properties of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.HitTestResult> object that is returned can then be used to determine which chart element was clicked; the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.HitTestResult> object also provides an instance of the actual object selected, if any.
The X-coordinate value of the point the user clicked on.
The Y-coordinate value of the point the user clicked on.
`true` to ignore transparent elements; otherwise, `false`.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.HitTestResult"></xref> object, which provides information concerning the chart element, if any, that is at the specified location.
Determines if a chart element of a given type is located at a point defined by given X and Y coordinates.
Call this method to determine if a chart element of the given type is located at a specified point.

The properties of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.HitTestResult> object that is returned can then be used to determine which chart element was clicked; the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.HitTestResult> object also provides an instance of the actual object selected, if any.
The X-coordinate value of the point the user clicked on.
The Y-coordinate value of the point the user clicked on.
A flag that determines the chart element type to be tested.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.HitTestResult"></xref> object, which provides information concerning the chart element, if any, that is at the specified location.
Determines whether a chart element that is one of the specified types is located at a point defined by the given X and Y coordinates.
Call this method to determine the gauge element, if any, which is located at a specified point.
This method is often used in some mouse-related event, for example, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.OnMouseDown%2A>, to determine which gauge element the end-user clicked.
The X and Y mouse coordinates obtained from the event parameters are then used for the X and Y parameter values of this method call.

The properties of the returned <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.HitTestResult> object can then be used to determine which chart element was clicked; the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.HitTestResult> object also provides an instance of the actual object selected, if any.
The X-coordinate for the specified data point.
The Y-coordinate for the specified data point.
`true` to ignore transparent elements; otherwise, `false`.
An array of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartElementType"></xref> objects that specify the types to test for, in order to filter the result.
If omitted, checking for element types will be ignored and all element types will be valid.
An array of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.HitTestResult"></xref> objects that provides information about the chart element, if any, found at the specified location.
The array contains at least one element, which can be <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartElementType.Nothing"></xref>.
The objects in the result are sorted from the top to the bottom of different layers of control.

Gets a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.NamedImagesCollection"></xref> object that stores <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.NamedImage"></xref> objects for the chart.

Use this property to add <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.NamedImage> objects to and remove <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.NamedImage> objects from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.NamedImagesCollection> object of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart>.
This collection property is available at run time only.

An image—that is, an object derived from type <xref:System.Drawing.Image>, such as <xref:System.Drawing.Bitmap>, that is created dynamically—can be stored in this collection, and then assigned at a later time to any image-related <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart> property, such as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.BackImage%2A>.

When you assign a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.NamedImage> object to an image-related property in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart> class, use the name of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.NamedImage> object for the `string` value of the image-related property.

A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.NamedImagesCollection"></xref> object that contains the collection of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.NamedImage"></xref> objects.

Invalidates the entire surface of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart"></xref> and causes the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart"></xref> control to be redrawn.
Invalidates the specified area of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart"></xref> control.
This method adds the specified area to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart> control's update area, which is the area that will be repainted at the next paint operation.
This method also causes a paint message to be sent to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart> control.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> object that specifies the area to invalidate.
Gets or sets a flag that determines if a smooth gradient is applied when shadows are drawn.
If the value of the `ShadowOffset` property for a series, data point, chart area or legend is nonzero, a shadow will be applied using a color set by their `ShadowColor` property.
If the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.IsSoftShadows%2A> property is `true`, a smooth gradient will be applied to the shadow.
`true` if shadows are drawn using smoothing; otherwise, `false`.
The default value is `true`.

Gets or sets a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.LegendCollection"></xref> that stores all <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend"></xref> objects used by the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart"></xref> control.
This collection property stores all <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend> objects used by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart> control.

A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.LegendCollection"></xref> object that contains the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Legend"></xref> objects used by the chart.
Loads a template with the specified filename from the disk.
The `name` parameter must use a full path, for example, C:\MyPic.jpg.
Note that you must also specify the file extension.
This method loads a template from disk that was saved using the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartSerializer.Save%2A> method.

Make sure to set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartSerializer.IsTemplateMode%2A> property to `true` before saving the template with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartSerializer.Save%2A> method.
If a loaded template has two data series, the appearance properties of the series are applied sequentially to the chart.

In other words, the first template series appearance properties are assigned to the first series of the chart, the second template series appearance properties are applied to the second series of the chart, then the first template series is used again for the third series of the chart, and so on.
The same holds true for chart areas, and any other collections that have appearance properties.
Templates can be used to simulate custom palettes.
The file name of the template to load.
You must specify the full path of the template to be loaded from the disk.
Loads a template into the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart"></xref> control from an image stream.
Use this method if you want to load a template from a stream, such as a memory stream, file stream, and so forth.

Make sure to set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartSerializer.IsTemplateMode%2A> property to `true` before saving the template with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartSerializer.Save%2A> method.
If a loaded template has two data series, the appearance properties of the series are applied sequentially to the chart.

In other words, the first template series appearance properties are assigned to the first series of the chart, the second template series appearance properties are applied to the second series of the chart, then the first template series is used again for the third series of the chart, and so on.
The same holds true for chart areas, and any other collections that have appearance properties.
Templates can be used to simulate custom palettes.
The stream to load from.

Overrides the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.OnCursorChanged(System.EventArgs)"></xref> method and raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.CursorPositionChanging"></xref> and <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.CursorPositionChanged"></xref> events.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.Customize"></xref> event.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.CustomizeLegend"></xref> event.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.LegendItemsCollection"></xref> object.
The name of the legend.
Overrides the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.OnDoubleClick(System.EventArgs)"></xref> method.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> object that contains the event arguments.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.FormatNumber"></xref> event.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.FormatNumberEventArgs"></xref> object that contains the event arguments.
Overrides the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.OnLocationChanged(System.EventArgs)"></xref> method.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> object that contains the event arguments.
Overrides the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.OnMouseDown(System.Windows.Forms.MouseEventArgs)"></xref> method.
A <xref href="System.MouseEventArgs"></xref> object that contains the event arguments.
Overrides the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.OnMouseMove(System.Windows.Forms.MouseEventArgs)"></xref> method.
A <xref href="System.MouseEventArgs"></xref> object that contains the event arguments.
Overrides the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.OnMouseUp(System.Windows.Forms.MouseEventArgs)"></xref> method.
A <xref href="System.MouseEventArgs"></xref> object that contains the event arguments.
Overrides the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.OnPaint(System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs)"></xref> method.
A <xref href="System.PaintEventArgs"></xref> object that contains the event arguments.
Overrides the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.OnPaintBackground(System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs)"></xref> method.
A <xref href="System.PaintEventArgs"></xref> object that contains the event arguments.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.PostPaint"></xref> event.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartPaintEventArgs"></xref> object that contains the event arguments.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.PrePaint"></xref> event.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartPaintEventArgs"></xref> object that contains the event arguments.
Overrides the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.OnResize(System.EventArgs)"></xref> method.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> object that contains the event arguments.
Overrides the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.OnRightToLeftChanged(System.EventArgs)"></xref> method.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> object that contains the event arguments.
Overrides the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.OnSystemColorsChanged(System.EventArgs)"></xref> method.
An <xref href="System.EventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Gets or sets the palette for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart"></xref> control.
A palette is used to automatically assign colors to data elements if both of the following conditions have been met:
the data points themselves do not have colors assigned to them.
the data series that the data points belong to also does not have an assigned color.

If no series or data point colors are explicitly specified, the colors used depend on the chart type and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart> object's palette or the palette of an associated series, if one is specified.

If the `Palette` property for both the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Series> objects is set to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartColorPalette>, and no color is assigned to the relevant data series or data points, the data points will not be drawn, and will be displayed as "empty" areas.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartColorPalette"></xref> enumeration value that determines the palette to be used.
Gets or sets an array of custom palette colors.
If you need more than 16 colors or you want to apply your own colors to the chart, you must define a custom palette.
A custom palette let you add your own colors in the order you want them to appear on the chart.
This type of palette is especially helpful if the number of series in your chart is unknown at design time.
This property has no effect when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.Palette%2A> property is *not* set to
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartColorPalette>.
An array of <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> objects that represent the set of colors used for series on the chart.
Occurs when the chart element is painted.
Occurs when the chart element background is painted.
Gets a read-only <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.PrintingManager"></xref> object used for printing a chart.
When a chart is printed, all chart elements except scrollbars will be printed.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.PrintingManager> object contains the following methods, which are used for basic printing operations:

<xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.PrintingManager.PageSetup%2A>: Displays a Page Setup dialog, which allows the end-user to select paper size, paper source, page orientation, and so forth.
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.PrintingManager.PrintPreview%2A>: Displays a Print Preview dialog, which allows the end-user to zoom, print the chart, and so forth.

<xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.PrintingManager.Print%2A>: Prints the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart>; the Print dialog can optionally be displayed prior to printing.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.PrintingManager"></xref> object used for printing a chart.
Forces the control to invalidate its client area and immediately redraw itself and any child controls.
Gets or sets the horizontal resolution of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart"></xref> renderer.
A `double` value that represents the horizontal resolution of the chart renderer.
Gets or sets the vertical resolution of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart"></xref> renderer.
A `double` value that represents the vertical resolution of the chart renderer.
Resets automatically calculated chart property values to "Auto".
Several chart properties can be set to "Auto"—for example, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Axis.Minimum%2A>; these properties are calculated prior to the chart being rendered.
"Auto" is usually represented as a <xref:System.Double.NaN> value.
Call this method to reset these properties from their calculated value to "Auto" (<xref:System.Double.NaN>).
Saves the chart image to the specified file.
The name of the file in which image is saved to.
The chart image format.
Saves an image to the specified file.
The name of the file in which image is saved to.
The image format.
Saves the image to the specifed stream.
The stream in which the image is saved to.
The image format.
Saves the chart image to the specified stream.
The stream in which the image is saved to.
The chart image format.
Occurs when the selection start position or end position is changed.
Occurs when the selection start or end position is about to change.
Gets a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartSerializer"></xref> object that is used for chart serialization.
Use this property at either design time or run time to serialize the chart.
For a detailed discussion of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartSerializer> class, refer to the class overview.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.ChartSerializer"></xref> object that is used for chart serialization.

Gets a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.SeriesCollection"></xref> object, which contains <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> objects.

This collection property allows you to access the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.SeriesCollection> class, which stores <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Series> objects and also provides methods and properties used to manipulate this collection.
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Series> objects store <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.DataPoint> objects, as well as data attributes.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.SeriesCollection"></xref> object which contains <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Series"></xref> objects.
Gets or sets the size of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart"></xref> control.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Size"></xref> object that represents the size of the control.
Gets or sets a flag that determines whether non-critical exceptions should be suppressed.
If you set this property to `true`, non-critical exceptions will be suppressed.
When the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart> control cannot properly plot the chart using the data and other settings provided, an exception will be thrown.
Although displaying exceptions is useful during application testing, they should not be shown when the application is released.
Setting this property to `true` may hide serious issues in the user application source code.
This setting could also cause a chart image to be generated that might misrepresent your data.
It is highly recommended that this mode be only used in Release builds.
`true` if non-critical exceptions should be suppressed; otherwise, `false`.
The default value is `false`.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.TextAntiAliasingQuality"></xref> type to use when applying anti-aliasing to text.
If the anti-aliasing is applied to text, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart> control will use this property to determine the type of textual anti-aliasing to apply.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.TextAntiAliasingQuality"></xref> enumeration value used to apply anti-aliasing to text.
The default value is <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.TextAntiAliasingQuality.High"></xref>.

Gets or sets a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.TitleCollection"></xref> object that is used to store all <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Title"></xref> objects used by the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart"></xref> control.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart.Titles%2A> property stores all <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Title> objects used by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart> control.

A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.TitleCollection"></xref> object that is used to store all <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Title"></xref> objects used by the chart control.
Updates the annotations in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart"></xref> control.
Updates the cursor in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataVisualization.Charting.Chart"></xref> control.
